intro: Crepidomanes longilabiatum, commonly known as the long-lipped sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Montiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it blooms during the spring or early summer. The species is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa.
